page.title: 11ASTLEY PARISH CHURCH(contd)
page.content: The church had a tower at the western end and a new small chancel at the eastern end.It was built in the Gothic style in gray sandstone(known locally as Attleborough sandstone). The tower is in red sandstone. The restoration cost Â£1200 mainly contributed by the Rt.Hon Charles Newdigate M.P. There are three 15/16 century tombs. They are Sir Edward Grey,Lord Ferrerd,Lady Liste and the Marchioness of Dorset. The chancel has a Gothic plastered ceiling.There are numerous heraldic shields there.In the Tower now there is a modern clock and five bells.
